title: ‘Surprise’ plans could bring ICE facility to Merrimack, N.H.

title: Police in Cape Cod warn against viral door-kicking social media trend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News “Try doing something kind or positive for those in your community instead of trying to scare someone,” police said.
Police in a Cape Cod town are warning residents about a viral door-kicking prank with potentially dangerous consequences.

The Bourne Police Department said Monday they have joined a growing list of law enforcement offices nationwide that have dealt with incidents related to the trend, which involves people kicking residents’ doors and running away.

title: Beheaded birds found dumped off Dedham bridge, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Animal control officers say the birds were found along a canal that is part of the Stony Brook Reservation.

title: Person falls to death on Boylston Street on New Year’s Eve
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The person was found "nonviable," a Boston police spokesperson said, after falling from the Mandarin Oriental.
ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A person died in Back Bay on New Year’s Eve after falling from the Mandarin Oriental on Boylston Street, police said.

title: Woman killed in hit-and-run crash while leaving New Year’s church gathering in New Bedford
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News Police are investigating the fatal crash but have not released information about the driver’s identity.
A woman was killed in a hit-and-run crash in New Bedford in the early hours of New Year’s Day, according to prosecutors.
New Bedford resident Nicolassa Ventura Colaj, 33, was fatally struck by an SUV just after midnight Jan.

title: Medford firefighter arrested in federal child exploitation sting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News The longtime firefighter is accused of sending pictures and videos to a person he thought was a 14-year-old girl.
A longtime Medford firefighter was arrested Monday night after he allegedly sent lewd images and videos to an undercover agent he thought was a 14-year-old, according to officials and reports.
Hugh McEleney, 63, is charged with dissemination of matter harmful to minors, Middlesex District Attorney Marian Ryan announced.
